title: In India, Narendra Modi targets BBC after documentary
description: The offices of the British broadcaster were searched by the tax authorities in New Delhi and Bombay, a few weeks after it aired a documentary on the prime minister.

title: Cinema icon Raquel Welch dies at 82
description: The US actress' manager said that she had died peacefully early on Wednesday morning after 'a brief illness.'

title: In Australia, alcohol banned once again in Aboriginal communities in the Northern Territory
description: In response to rising crime, the authorities have temporarily reinstated alcohol consumption bans, giving the opportunity to work out solutions with the communities concerned.

title: Munich airport scraps flights Friday over strike
description: Over 700 passenger flights will be canceled just as the city is to host the Munich Security Conference

title: In Afghanistan, the Taliban are facing their first regime crisis
description: The leader of the Islamic emirate is clashing with those in favor of compromising with the international community, including both the interior minister and defense minister.

title: Spain raises minimum wage by 8%
description: This new increase brings the minimum wage to €1,080 gross per month over 14 months. But government support for inflation is limited.

title: Mars: traces of lake waves discovered on the Red Planet's soil
description: In its ascent of Mount Sharp, NASA's Curiosity rover came across surfaces wrinkled by water movement.

title: 'Tchaikovsky's Wife': A psychological thriller about a spouse's descent into hell
description: In his latest film, director Kirill Serebrennikov evokes the Russian composer's homosexuality and his estranged marital life.

title: French FA chief Le Graët 'no longer has legitimacy' to stay in post, says report
description: The report, which was ordered by France's Sports Ministry, highlights his conduct toward women, his public comments and the governance failings of the French Football Federation.

title: From YouTube to French TV, an intricate web of lies about Russian oligarchs' yachts in Monaco
description: #StoryKillers. An elaborate campaign, including fake protests and stories broadcast on BFM-TV, targeted sanctions against Russian billionaires' ships in France in late 2022.

title: Shooter gets life sentence for Buffalo market massacre
description: Payton Gendron killed 10 Black people and still faces separate federal charges that could carry a death sentence.

title: Drug spat ruffles European institutions in Brussels
description: A Belgian official sparked outcry by suggesting that EU officials are using illegal substances he said were 'probably a little whiter' than in other parts of the city.

title: In the United States, air transportation is once again generating profits – and controversy
description: While flight traffic has returned to pre-pandemic levels, prohibitive pricing and increasingly minimalist in-flight services are prompting some elected officials to push for greater protections for passengers.

title: 9 in 10 Black people in mainland France say they are victims of racist discrimination
description: According to a survey commissioned by the Representative Council of France's Black Associations, only a quarter of victims filed a complaint.

title: China's top diplomat meets with Macron to kick off Europe tour
description: Wan Yi will also make stops in Italy, Hungary, Russia and Germany, where he will attend the Munich Security Conference.

title: Aid begins to reach Syria's rebel northwest region days after earthquakes
description: Chaos and political negotiations have delayed the arrival of emergency aid to these areas, devastated by the February 6 earthquake.

title: NATO countries discuss future defense spending
description: Almost one year after the beginning of the war in Ukraine, some member countries are pushing to go beyond a 2%-of-GDP ratio they must spend on weapons by 2024.

title: Russian journalist jailed for six years after her post on Mariupol
description: Maria Ponomarenko was sentenced under military censorship laws after posting about the bombing of a theater in Mariupol.

title: The death of Arne Treholt, the most famous Norwegian spy
description: Sentenced to 20 years in prison in 1985 after being found guilty of spying for the KGB, the former journalist, government official and diplomat was pardoned seven years later.

title: Italy's Berlusconi acquitted in 'bunga bunga' bribe case
description: Prosecutors had accused the former prime minister of paying young starlets and others for silence over what he called elegant dinners.

title: FIFA president Gianni Infantino to receive €1.66 million post-World Cup bonus
description: According to FIFA's 2022 annual report, the president of football's governing body was paid €3.62 million in 2022. FIFA's earnings reached a record high.

title: Out of the lab and into the streets: Scientists turn to activism to combat climate change
description: Frustrated by what they call the inaction of political leaders and the feeling that their voices are not being heard, thousands of researchers are engaging in civil disobedience actions.

title: Woman's body found in Paris Buttes-Chaumont park identified, investigation continues
description: City parks and gardens workers discovered a plastic bag containing a woman's pelvis and thighs under a pile of green waste on Monday.

title: Ohio train derailment raises issues of water and air safety
description: Local residents in the Ohio village devastated when a train derailed have many questions about their own safety as they return to their homes.

title: Nicola Sturgeon to resign as Scotland's leader, British media report
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is set to resign after eight years of leading the Scottish government.

title: UN calls for $5.6 billion in aid to Ukraine in 2023
description: The intergovernmental body says 21.8 million Ukrainians are in need of humanitarian assistance.

title: China: Hundreds of pensioners protest in Wuhan over insurance reform
description: Reforms to China's public health insurance system reduced the allowances paid monthly to retirees, prompting rare protests.

title: War in Ukraine: 'Why are Europe's munition factories not running at full capacity?'
description: European states must provide means to support Ukrainian artillery as soon as possible. One year after the start of the war, the sense of urgency is overdue, writes 'Le Monde' columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Like cars, trucks in Europe will have to phase out combustion engines
description: A legislative proposal from the European Commission calls for CO₂ emissions from new trucks to be cut by 90% by 2040, following a heated battle with supporters of a more ambitious target.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Athletes stay quiet on possible return of Russians and Belarusians
description: The issue is on the agenda of an IOC meeting on Wednesday in Lausanne, Switzerland. But despite causing turmoil among the world's sporting authorities and national governments, few athletes have spoken out on the matter.

title: #StoryKillers: The links between Israel-based 'Team Jorge' and a French TV presenter who aired fake news
description: #StoryKillers. The investigation carried out by 'Le Monde' and its partners at the Forbidden Stories consortium discovered that BFM-TV presenter Rachi M'Barki personally selected and presented segments that his editors had never approved.

title: #StoryKillers: A deep dive into 'Team Jorge', the disinformation mercenaries operating worldwide
description: 'Le Monde' and the Forbidden Stories consortium reveal the inner workings of these operatives based in Israel who provide smear and disinformation campaigns shared by tens of thousands of fake accounts on social media.

title: Are Paris 2024 Olympics tickets really going to be affordable?
description: From February 15 to March 15, people selected by a lottery can buy tickets to attend the Olympic competitions. Ticket prices have risen compared to previous Olympics.

title: Portuguese Catholic Church shaken by report of 5,000 child-victims of sexual abuse
description: An independent panel has issued a shocking report about the abuse of young children over many years.

title: First annual profit for Airbnb in 2022 as travel rebounds
description: The home-rental platform said it made a profit of $319 million in the final quarter of last year on revenue of nearly $2 billion.

title: White House remains tight-lipped over UFOs shot down in US and Canadian skies
description: Partial revelations by US authorities have left the public uncertain and the Republican opposition in a state of growing agitation.

title: Biden administration dumps human rights candidate over anti-Israel comments
description: James Cavallaro's candidacy to serve as a member of the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights was pulled after calling Israel an 'apartheid state.'

title: 'Air India's unprecedented order of Airbus and Boeing craft highlights obliviousness to climate alarms'
description: 'Jobs first' seemed to be the message of the agreement reached on Tuesday, February 14, on the delivery of 500 aircraft to the Indian airline, by a sector already at full capacity and struggling to meet demand on time, writes Jean-Michel Bezat.

title: Mbappé can't save slumping PSG in Champions League loss to Bayern Munich
description: The Parisian club appeared to be stuck in a rut as it suffered its third straight loss. Meanwhile AC Milan's Brahim Diaz fired his team to a 1-0 win over Tottenham in day one of the league's round-of-16 matches.
